content.description: Start at the bottom left side of the boulder on right hand iron flake crimp gaston and left hand edge. Follow the lip up and right using a combination of slopers pockets and edges eventually topping out on the tallest point of the boulder.
content.location: Downhill from zen arcade. It is the shorter of the two triangular shaped boulders that are next to each other.

content.description: Work straight up the slabby face on nice holds.
content.location: South face of Knock First boulder, east side of trail

content.description: Sit start in hole on left side of face. Work up to horizontal and finish same as problem 1. Don't fall in the water.
content.location: East side of boulder, just on west side of the trail

content.description: Start matched in hole to the right.
content.location: East side of boulder, just west of trail

content.description: Sit start at left end of ledge, work straight up nice pockets to crux at top out

Use your head, shoulders, knees, and toes to overcome gravity on this one. Maybe pack a booster rocket or two!    Start matched on the right side of the big ledge under the boulder and work straight up the sloping pockets until you're standing on the small ledge at head height.
content.location: South side of boulder, west side of trail down by the creek. This problem roughly faces Both Sides of the Story.

content.description: Sit start on flake low and right, follow juggy flake holds slightly left then straight up. Choose holds carefully, holds on the left side of feature are delicate.
content.location: North side of boulder, visible from trail.

content.description: Start matched on flake at chest height, head straight up to topout.
content.location: Located on the main hiking trail. Sloped landing. Down climb back of boulder (V-Easy)

content.description: Sit start in the pit and squeeze and shift your way up the prow. Cool and challenging.
content.location: North side of boulder, east side of trail.

content.description: Start matched on ledge at edge of roof. Campus, dyno, or foot jump your way to the lip.    Potential low start looks quite hard and holds look friable.
content.location: East side of boulder, west side of trail

content.description: Start by walking your feet up the obvious ramp feature. At 10' there is a large ledge. Choose a final move to get over the lip. Fun and varied.
content.location: On the large boulder facing the route Working Class. Walk off the backside of the boulder.

content.description: Short and fat and fun. Use just the offwidth crack to get up to the lip of the boulder and top out.
content.location: East side of boulder on east side of trail.

content.description: Start matched on horn and go straight up through face.
content.location: North side of boulder, west side of trail, near the creek

content.description: The base of Big Star wall is home to roughly 20 climbable boulders. The Sandstone Warrior guidebook lists an area they call Railroad Boulders but provides no detail about specific problems. Most if not all of the problems have likely been climbed in the past. This page will allow some documentation and perhaps clarification about the history of the problems. All names given here are just working titles. If you know of existing names for a problem just leave a comment or send a message and I'll update the info. Increased traffic to these boulders will hopefully keep them from getting overgrown again.
